definition: variant of 幫凶|帮凶[bang1 xiong1]
to help/to assist/to support/for sb (i.e. as a help)/hired (as worker)/side (of pail, boat etc)/outer layer/upper (of a shoe)/group/gang/clique/party/secret society

sentences.english: Their victims from the feudal system, become the accomplices of the feudal rulers.
sentences.chinese: 她們由封建制度的受害者，變成封建統治者的幫兇。

sentences.english: Somehow, we are all complicit in her ruination .
sentences.chinese: 也不知怎的，我們每人都是她毀容的幫兇。

sentences.english: It is the accomplice of Japanese invaders to carry out ideological enslavement activities in enemy-occupied area.
sentences.chinese: 它是日本侵略者在淪陷區實行思想奴化活動的幫兇。

sentences.english: La Boétie notes that the tyrant and his chiefs rarely live out their natural ends.
sentences.chinese: 拉博埃蒂指出暴君以及他的主要幫兇很少活到天年。

sentences.english: I do think, however, that tyranny requires an environment of collusion.
sentences.chinese: 但是我也認爲，暴政需要幫兇才能成事。

sentences.english: We shall strike hard, without flinching, at terrorists and those who abet them.
sentences.chinese: 我們要毫不退縮地嚴厲打擊恐怖分子及其幫兇。

sentences.english: She was her husband's accomplice in murdering a rich old man.
sentences.chinese: 她是她丈夫謀殺一個老富翁的幫兇。

sentences.english: When a crime was in quest of arms, they under-let their accomplices.
sentences.chinese: 當一件犯罪行爲在尋找助力，他們便轉租幫兇。

definition: variant of 誣衊|诬蔑[wu1 mie4]
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
to call loudly (idiom); to get people's attention/to make one's views known
to obscure the facts (idiom); to mislead the public with prevarication and deliberate falsehoods
to kill sb for his property (idiom); to murder for money
making a deer out to be a horse (idiom); deliberate misrepresentation
